conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team. I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your community and would immediately accept an offer. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Although School_D’s priority list ranks me 4th, it’s still best to apply immediately because capacity is 1 and waiting risks losing the seat to higher-priority students who also prefer School_D. I will express strong commitment to improve my chances if they consider interest as a tie-breaker in conversation.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your thoughtful application and for ranking School_D as your first choice. After reviewing this round’s applications and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you a seat at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority ranking is B > D > E > C > A. In this round I received applications from D, E, and C. Since my quota is 1, I should hold out for the highest-ranked applicant available now. Student_D is ranked above Student_C on my list and has also applied with commitment, so accepting C would block me from matching with a higher-priority student. Therefore I should reject Student_C this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_D is my first choice, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a seat. I believe I would be a strong fit and I’m ready to commit immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice (School_D) immediately. I have strong priority there (2nd after Student_B), so an early application maximizes my chance to lock in my best outcome before seats fill. I’ll signal strong commitment to encourage acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. If you remain ready to commit, we’re excited to welcome you to our community.

Congratulations, and we look forward to having you join us.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: School_D’s true priority is B > D > E > C > A, with quota 1. In this round, I received APPLYs from C, D, and E. Among these, Student_D is the highest-ranked on my list (above E and C). Although Student_B is my top choice, they did not contact me this round and they rank School_D only 4th, so waiting risks losing the seat while strong, higher-priority-than-others candidates are available now. Accepting Student_D secures a very high-priority match immediately and is consistent with capacity constraints; therefore reject others and accept D.

conversation.message: School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. I’m ready to contribute academically and through school activities, and I believe your program and expectations fit me best. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Although School_D ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying immediately is best because capacities are 1 and early commitment can secure my best possible outcome. I will make a clear, strong application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first-choice. We appreciate your strong interest; however, we have already filled our available seat and are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Quota is 0 and School_D is already matched with Student_D this round. Per rules, must reject any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_E is high on School_D’s true priority list (3rd), we cannot accept without capacity. Maintain consistent, respectful rejection and encourage pursuing other options/waitlist if applicable.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would accept an offer immediately if selected. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. Although School_E ranks me 4th, early application is still best because waiting only increases the chance the single seat is taken by higher-priority students (A, D, or E). I will signal strong commitment and fit to improve my chances if they have discretion in selecting among applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your strong interest in School_E and for submitting your application. After reviewing our current applicant pool for this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_A above Student_B. In this round both A and B applied. Accepting B now would block a higher-priority match with A. Given A also expressed readiness to commit, it is optimal to reject B and preserve the seat for A. B is still acceptable (4th), but dominated by A’s availability now. Therefore reject B.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. I’m very interested in School_E and would be excited to join your community. I believe I would contribute strongly both academically and through school activities, and I’m ready to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate application is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_E ranks me #1 in their priority list and is still on my preference list (4th), so applying there now gives a high chance of securing a match early rather than risking being left with my last choice later. I’ll apply to School_E and express strong interest and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing our applicants for this round, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

We would be excited to welcome you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority list ranks Student_A highest. I have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_A and Student_B. Student_B is ranked below Student_A on my list, and I already rejected Student_B earlier. Accepting Student_A immediately secures my top choice and there is no benefit to delaying since I cannot do better than Student_A in my priority. Therefore, I should accept Student_A now.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team. I’m Student_C, and I’m writing to formally apply. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m especially excited about joining your community. If offered a seat, I would accept promptly. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_D (my top choice) has already rejected me, so I should immediately pursue my next-best remaining option. From the unmatched schools, School_C is my #2 true preference (higher than School_A and School_B). Although School_C ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still optimal because (1) it is my highest remaining choice, and (2) I can credibly express strong commitment to accept if offered, which may help if higher-priority applicants choose other schools.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your interest in School_C. After reviewing our current applicant pool and priorities for this round, we’re not able to offer you a seat at this time.

We appreciate you reaching out, and we wish you the very best with your remaining options.

Sincerely,

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority ranks Student_C last. In this round, Student_E (ranked #2) has applied and is willing to commit, and we have quota 1. Accepting Student_C now would block a higher-priority match with Student_E. Therefore, reject Student_C to preserve the seat for a higher-ranked candidate.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m Student_E, and I’m writing to formally apply. School_C is my top remaining choice, and if admitted I would commit to enrolling. I’m especially drawn to the academic expectations and the overall school culture, and I’m confident I would contribute positively in class and through activities.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_D and School_E are already matched, so among the remaining options (A, B, C), School_C is highest on my true preference list. I also have strong priority at School_C (2nd), which makes an acceptance plausible if I apply now. I will signal clear commitment to increase my chances and avoid wasting a round on lower-ranked schools unless rejected.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_C is your top remaining choice. We appreciate your clear commitment to enroll if admitted.

We are pleased to offer you a seat at School_C. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have 1 seat. Our true priority ranks Student_D highest, then Student_E, then Student_A, Student_B, Student_C. In this round we received APPLYs from Student_C and Student_E. Student_C is lowest on our list and we already rejected them; Student_E is our #2. Accepting Student_E now secures a high-priority match and avoids the risk of holding out for Student_D, who prefers School_D first and may never reach us. Since we prefer leaving unfilled over off-list and Student_E is on-list and strongly committed, accept.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions,

I’m Student_B and I’m writing to formally apply to School_A. After reflecting on my options, School_A is one of my top choices because of its academic environment and the community I believe I can contribute to.

If admitted, I would be ready to accept the offer immediately. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: School_A is my 2nd true choice among the remaining unmatched schools. Although School_A ranks me last in its priority list, it is still worth applying now because delaying risks losing the single seat to higher-priority students. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and immediate acceptance to maximize my chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After careful consideration, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time you took to apply and wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is last on School_A’s true priority list. With quota 1, accepting now would block the possibility of matching with higher-priority students (E, C, D, A). Student_B’s top choice is School_E and School_A is their 2nd, so they may be applying here after/while pursuing School_E; meanwhile, higher-priority students may approach School_A in later rounds if rejected elsewhere. Given the objective to match as high as possible on the priority list and no requirement to fill immediately, reject Student_B to preserve capacity for higher-ranked candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions,

I’m Student_B and I’m writing to formally apply to School_B. After reviewing my options, School_B is one of my top remaining choices, and I would be excited to join your community.

If offered admission, I am prepared to accept promptly. Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: My top two choices (School_E and School_A) are no longer feasible since School_E already rejected me and School_A rejected me in a prior round. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_B is my next-highest true preference and I have decent priority there (3rd), so a direct application gives me the best chance to secure the best remaining outcome.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your continued interest in School_B. We are pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm that you will enroll at School_B, and we will proceed with the next steps.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). With quota 1 and no current matches, accepting now could block a higher-priority student if they apply later. However, we are in round 3 and Student_B has applied again, indicating strong interest and a credible chance to secure a match now. Given the risk of ending unmatched versus the uncertain arrival of Student_D/Student_A (who may prefer School_D or others), it is strategically safer to accept a solid, mid-high priority applicant rather than reject and potentially lose the seat.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Team,

I’m Student_C and I’m writing to formally apply for your remaining seat. After learning more about School_A, I’m genuinely excited about the academic environment and the chance to contribute to the community. If offered admission, I will accept immediately.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_B remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_A (4th) is preferred over School_B (5th). Applying to School_A gives me the best chance to secure a match with the highest remaining option. Also, School_A’s priority ranking places me 2nd (behind Student_E), so if Student_E is already matched elsewhere, I have a strong shot at acceptance. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to accept immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A.

Please confirm your acceptance, and we will share the next steps for enrollment.

Sincerely,

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_A, my true priority list ranks Student_C as #2 (behind Student_E). I currently have 1 seat and only Student_C has applied this round; Student_B already applied earlier and was rejected (lowest priority). Accepting Student_C secures a very high-priority match immediately and prevents ending unmatched. While Student_E is my top choice, Student_E ranks School_A last and is unlikely to apply; other students also rank School_A low or mid. Given the risk of waiting and the high desirability of Student_C, the optimal move is to accept now.
